description: Borrowed from Latin īsoscelēs, from Ancient Greek ἰσοσκελής (isoskelḗs, “equal-legged”), from ἴσος (ísos, “equal”) +‎ σκέλος (skélos, “leg”) +‎ -ής (-ḗs, adjective suffix).

entries.meaning: (geometry) Having (at least) two sides of equal length, used especially of a triangle or trapezoid.
